input_text:
Job Title: Software Development Analyst 3/4

Location: Melbourne, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Northrop Grumman's Corporate organization is seeking a Principal/Sr. Principal Software Development Analyst at its Melbourne, FL location.

The selected candidate will provide Application Engineering (AE) that supports, maintains, and resolves incidents on enterprise-wide Systems and Software engineering tools and applications software. This role demands IT-focused end-user support in areas of best practice development, operations support, and problem resolution for the engineering community.

Additional Responsibilities

End-user support of System and Software engineering software included in the Engineering Systems Pool (ESP)Provide system maintenance, licenses management, software installations, upgrade deployments, operations support, test support, and system troubleshooting while meeting software compliance standards.Monitor, address, and resolve Systems and Software production environment incidents, service requests, workflows, client install packages, etc.Document all aspects of system support such that knowledge is readily shared among all those tasked with supporting Systems and Software.Provide demos to users as and when required.

Basic Qualifications: 

Principal Software Development Analyst

At minimum, 5 Years with a bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or equivalent; 3 Years with Masters; 0 Years with PhD.Experience with application administration.Understanding of applications related to systems and software engineering principles, practices, and theories.Must work well with others in a professional setting regardless of skillsets.Ability to understand and work with multiple enterprise-wide systems and software problem tracking tools such as DOORs, MATLAB, Cameo. And Jira.Must have current Security + Certification or willingness to obtain within 6 months.

Sr Principal Software Development Analyst

At minimum, 9 Years with a bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or equivalent; 7 Years with Masters; 4 Years with PhD.Experience with application administration.Understanding of applications related to systems and software engineering principles, practices, and theories.Must work well with others in a professional setting regardless of skillsets.Ability to understand and work with multiple enterprise-wide systems and software ALM (Algorithm Lifecycle Management) tools such as Jira, Confluence, Git and Bitbucket.Experience with setting up system engineering tools such as Atlassian, DOORs, MATLAB, STK, Cameo, Teamwork cloud, and/or Azure DevOps.Understand and practice Agile and Waterfall project management methodology.Ability to lead and provide guidance to others on the team.Must have current Security + Certification or willingness to obtain within 6 months.

Preferred Qualifications:

Current Security + CertificationCurrent DOD Security ClearanceExcellent written communication and interpersonal skillsExperience as an End User for system engineering tools such as Atlassian, DOORs, MATLAB, STK, Cameo, Teamwork cloud, and/or Azure DevOps.Understand the difference between UML and SysML.Ability to script and conduct matrix calculation with MATLAB and Simulink.Ability to code DXL script to ingress user and group permission.Strong analytical and problem-solving skillsWork well under pressure and adapt well to unplanned tasks.Ability and willingness to continuously learn and implement new processes.Dedicated to teamwork and be ability to work well in a team environment.

Salary Range: $92,600 - $139,000

Salary Range 2: $114,900 - $172,300

The above salary range represents a general guideline; however, Northrop Grumman considers a number of factors when determining base salary offers such as the scope and responsibilities of the position and the candidate's experience, education, skills and current market conditions.

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

The application period for the job is estimated to be 20 days from the job posting date. However, this timeline may be shortened or extended depending on business needs and the availability of qualified candidates.

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for all positions with a government clearance and certain other restricted positions.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Principal/Sr. Principal Software Development Analyst
output_json.summary: Northrop Grumman seeks a Software Development Analyst at its Melbourne, FL location.

soft_skills: understanding and working with multiple systems

System maintenance, licenses management, software installations, upgrade deployments
Operations support, test support, and system troubleshooting
